text: The 1936 Philadelphia Phillies season was a season in Major League Baseball. The Phillies finished eighth in the National League with a record of 54 wins and 100 losses. == Offseason == * November 21, 1935: Al Todd was traded by the Phillies to the Pittsburgh Pirates for Claude Passeau and Earl Grace.Earl Grace page at Baseball Reference == Regular season == * July 10, 1936: Chuck Klein of the Phillies hit four home runs in a ten inning game against the Pittsburgh Pirates at Forbes Field.Great Baseball Feats, Facts and Figures, 2008 Edition, p. 258, David Nemec and Scott Flatow, A Signet Book, Penguin Group, New York, === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Notable transactions === * May 24, 1936: Johnny Vergez was purchased from the Phillies by the St. Louis Cardinals.Johnny Vergez page at Baseball Reference === Roster === {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
